snippet: The transportation bill that just passed is far from perfect, but at least it more closely resembles the solid Senate measure than the appalling House one.
abstract: Editorial applauds the approval of a serviceable transportation bill by Congress, a day before the program was due to expire; observes that the bill is flawed, but is vastly preferable to the one proposed by the House; warns that the bill does not provide long-term footing for the transportation system, and the gas tax that is the system's main source of funding will have to be increased.
lead_paragraph: The transportation bill that just passed is far from perfect, but at least it more closely resembles the solid Senate measure than the appalling House one.
